intro: Telekia cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Telekia cordifolia is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
